coredata.dc:title: Molecular quadrupole moment determinations from measurements of laser wave hyper-Rayleigh scattering by dense fluids
coredata.dc:creator: Lalanne, J.R.
Martin, F.B.
Kielich, S.
coredata.dc:description:
Abstract
Hyper-Rayleigh scattering (second-harmonic scattering, SHS) of laser waves by dense fluids composed of centro-symmetric molecules permits the measurement of the mean-squared value of the internal molecular electric field 〈F 0 2〉. In the case of quadrupolar molecules, these measured values can be used to determine the quadrupole moment of the scattering molecules. Numerical results are given for cyclohexane and trans-decahydronaphthalene amounting to 11 and 9.8, respectively, in 10−26 esu.
